Omega/Alpha Squad Jhin- "There's nothing beautiful left here."
Debonair Jhin/ Gentleman Jhin- "Your existence is rather, drab."
Wild Card Jhin- "No beauty compares than the order of chaos."
Frozen Jhin - "Eternal Beauty"
Headhunter Jhin

^Pretty pls, Rito? x)

I'd love to see Omega Squad Jhin. Though I want Omega Squad everything. Omega Squad Teemo was one of the best skins Riot has come out with lately, and it actually made sense unlike some more recent skins (looking at you, Lunar Revel Cait and Morg).

I feel like Royal Guard Jhin would be awesome too, a great counterpart to Fiora's. They're both rather artsy, though in completely different ways.

And I'm just imagining Cosmic Jhin's ult turning the ground within the targeting reticle into a galaxy, and his trap doing the same. Ooh, and his skillshot being a shooting star.

So many bright ideas that could be made for Jhin, but I doubt any of them will be made because Riot will probably make another Cait/Lee/*insert the champs who already have a thousand skins that keep getting even more here* skin before Jhin ever gets a decent one after High Noon. And by decent, I mean not something that just looks like a recolor of his classic.

They need to stop playing favorites and work those creative minds on champions who haven't gotten skins in a long time. Warwick, for instance, would have been perfect for this Lunar Revel. And Casseopeia. Like, seriously Riot. Those two need good new skins, and they wasted the perfect opportunity.

What about Arctic Ops Jhin instead of just Frozen Jhin? He would fit nicely alongside Varus and Kennen in that skin line, I think. 

Also, I really want PROJECT: Jhin to be a thing. That and Headhunter. They can't NOT give him a headhunter (or Debonair, for that matter) skin. Not with his personality.

"Im strangling Mr. {{champion:104}} for bringing up my wife."
I still don't understand the lore behind the champion. I understand he wears a mask to hide his identity, but where did his fascination in killing originate?
His father, Handsome Jack

I wonder....

In **A Good Death**(the Kindred story),there's a character named Illusian who is the playwright and company owner of the Orphellum Mechanicals, a travelling theatre troup. He is quoted as having an "insistences on complete artistic control" which lost him a few actors in the long run and at one point, he argues with his actors about his simplistic plots, asserting that "complicated plots detracted from a good death scene".

Now I know at the end it said he was burned to a crisp, but it could have been someone else (movie and books do tend to pull that trick) or it could have seemed like that to Magga. Maybe he survived, but got close enough to death to see the Kindred killing and got inspired by them or something and became Jhin. 

Not the best theory I admit, but it is an idea.

There petty contrasted. I say his ult should get changed so that all enemies get taunted in an aoe around him+ dealing "X" magic damage and a scaling of "Y" ap. Then trox gives allies buffs (atk spd,ms,ap/ad,etc). Honestly i would like to see Aatrox reworked into an "AP(Auto ATK),ATK SPD,Tank(with his W heal),and DPS/Juggernaut". Would be interesting...
